alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 1:46PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Columbia, Dane, Green Lake, Iowa, Marquette and Sauk. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baraboo, Portage, Reedsburg, Windsor, Prairie Du Sac, Sauk City, Lake Wisconsin, Deforest, Lodi, Poynette, Pardeeville, Randolph, Spring Green, West Baraboo, Rio, Cambria, Manchester, Dane, Arlington and Plain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
